```java
package com.tama.layoutjfx;

import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class HelloApplication extends Application {
 @Override
 public void start(Stage stage) throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader fxmlLoader = new FXMLLoader(HelloApplication.class.getResource("hello-view.fxml"));
 Scene scene = new Scene(fxmlLoader.load());
 stage.setTitle("Hello!");
 stage.setScene(scene);
 stage.setResizable(false);
 stage.show();
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch();
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Key changes:
1. Removed the HBox and used GridPane.halignment="LEFT" for button positioning
2. Adjusted the GridPane size to prefHeight="100.0" prefWidth="280.0"
3. Reduced padding to 8.0 on all sides
4. Set specific column widths (80px for labels, 200px for fields)
5. Updated HelloApplication.java to use the FXML's natural size and made window non-resizable

````java path=TrialFX/TrialLayout/JFXLayout/src/main/java/com/tama/layoutjfx/HelloApplication.java mode=EDIT
package com.tama.layoutjfx;

import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class HelloApplication extends Application {
 @Override
 public void start(Stage stage) throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader fxmlLoader = new FXMLLoader(HelloApplication.class.getResource("hello-view.fxml"));
 Scene scene = new Scene(fxmlLoader.load());
 stage.setTitle("Hello!");
 stage.setScene(scene);
 stage.setResizable(false);
 stage.show();
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch();
 }
}
````

Key changes:
1. Removed the HBox and used GridPane.halignment="LEFT" for button positioning
2. Adjusted the GridPane size to prefHeight="100.0" prefWidth="280.0"
3. Reduced padding to 8.0 on all sides
4. Set specific column widths (80px for labels, 200px for fields)
5. Updated HelloApplication.java to use the FXML's natural size and made window non-resizable

<augment_code_snippet path="TrialFX/TrialLayout/JFXLayout/src/main/resources/com/tama/layoutjfx/VBox.fxml" mode="EDIT">

```xml
<?import javafx.scene.layout.GridPane?>
<?import javafx.scene.layout.RowConstraints?>
<?import javafx.scene.layout.VBox?>

<VBox maxHeight="Infinity" maxWidth="Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="400.0" prefWidth="600.0" spacing="5.0" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/23.0.1" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1">

 <Insets bottom="5.0" left="5.0" right="5.0" top="5.0" />
 </padding>
 <children>
 <GridPane VBox.vgrow="NEVER">
 <columnConstraints>
```

Now you need to create or update a Java class to load this FXML and allow the window to be maximized:

<augment_code_snippet path="TrialFX/TrialLayout/JFXLayout/src/main/java/com/tama/layoutjfx/VBoxApp.java" mode="EDIT">
```java
package com.tama.layoutjfx;

import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class VBoxApp extends Application {
 @Override
 public void start(Stage stage) throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader fxmlLoader = new FXMLLoader(VBoxApp.class.getResource("VBox.fxml"));
 Scene scene = new Scene(fxmlLoader.load());
 stage.setTitle("VBox Example");
 stage.setScene(scene);
 stage.setMaximized(true); // Start maximized
 stage.show();
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch();
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Also, update the pom.xml to use this class as the main class:

<augment_code_snippet path="TrialFX/TrialLayout/JFXLayout/pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<plugin>
 <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
 <artifactId>javafx-maven-plugin</artifactId>
 <version>0.0.8</version>
 <executions>
 <execution>
 <!-- Default configuration for running with: mvn clean javafx:run -->
 <id>default-cli</id>
 <configuration>
 <mainClass>com.tama.layoutjfx.VBoxApp</mainClass>
 <launcher>app</launcher>
 <jlinkZipName>app</jlinkZipName>
 <jlinkImageName>app</jlinkImageName>
 <noManPages>true</noManPages>
 <stripDebug>true</stripDebug>
 <noHeaderFiles>true</noHeaderFiles>
 </configuration>
 </execution>
 </executions>
</plugin>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Key changes:
1. Changed VBox maxHeight/maxWidth to "Infinity" to allow unlimited growth
2. Set VBox.vgrow="NEVER" for the GridPane to keep it at its preferred size
3. Set VBox.vgrow="ALWAYS" for the TableView to make it expand to fill available space
4. Created a VBoxApp class that loads the FXML and sets stage.setMaximized(true)
5. Updated the pom.xml to use VBoxApp as the main class

Here's how to update your VBox.fxml file:

````xml path=TrialFX/TrialLayout/JFXLayout/src/main/resources/com/tama/layoutjfx/VBox.fxml mode=EDIT
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<?import javafx.geometry.Insets?>
<?import javafx.scene.control.Label?>
<?import javafx.scene.control.TableColumn?>
<?import javafx.scene.control.TableView?>
<?import javafx.scene.control.TextField?>
<?import javafx.scene.layout.ColumnConstraints?>
<?import javafx.scene.layout.GridPane?>
<?import javafx.scene.layout.RowConstraints?>
<?import javafx.scene.layout.VBox?>

<VBox maxHeight="Infinity" maxWidth="Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="400.0" prefWidth="600.0" spacing="5.0" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/23.0.1" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1">
 <padding>
 <Insets bottom="5.0" left="5.0" right="5.0" top="5.0" />
 </padding>
 <children>
 <GridPane VBox.vgrow="NEVER">
 <columnConstraints>
 <ColumnConstraints hgrow="SOMETIMES" minWidth="10.0" prefWidth="100.0" />
 <ColumnConstraints hgrow="SOMETIMES" minWidth="10.0" prefWidth="100.0" />
 </columnConstraints>
 <rowConstraints>
 <RowConstraints minHeight="10.0" prefHeight="30.0" vgrow="SOMETIMES" />
 <RowConstraints minHeight="10.0" prefHeight="30.0" vgrow="SOMETIMES" />
 <RowConstraints minHeight="10.0" prefHeight="30.0" vgrow="SOMETIMES" />
 </rowConstraints>
 <children>
 <TextField GridPane.columnIndex="1" />
 <TextField GridPane.columnIndex="1" GridPane.rowIndex="1" />
 <TextField GridPane.columnIndex="1" GridPane.rowIndex="2" />
 <Label text="Label" />
 <Label text="Label" GridPane.rowIndex="1" />
 <Label text="Label" GridPane.rowIndex="2" />
 </children>
 </GridPane>
 <TableView prefHeight="200.0" prefWidth="200.0" tableMenuButtonVisible="true" VBox.vgrow="ALWAYS">
 <columns>
 <TableColumn prefWidth="75.0" text="C1" />
 <TableColumn prefWidth="75.0" text="C2" />
 </columns>
 <columnResizePolicy>
 <TableView fx:constant="CONSTRAINED_RESIZE_POLICY" />
 </columnResizePolicy>
 </TableView>
 </children>
</VBox>
````

Now you need to create or update a Java class to load this FXML and allow the window to be maximized:

````java path=TrialFX/TrialLayout/JFXLayout/src/main/java/com/tama/layoutjfx/VBoxApp.java mode=EDIT
package com.tama.layoutjfx;

import javafx.application.Application;
import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
import javafx.scene.Scene;
import javafx.stage.Stage;

import java.io.IOException;

public class VBoxApp extends Application {
 @Override
 public void start(Stage stage) throws IOException {
 FXMLLoader fxmlLoader = new FXMLLoader(VBoxApp.class.getResource("VBox.fxml"));
 Scene scene = new Scene(fxmlLoader.load());
 stage.setTitle("VBox Example");
 stage.setScene(scene);
 stage.setMaximized(true); // Start maximized
 stage.show();
 }

 public static void main(String[] args) {
 launch();
 }
}
````

Also, update the pom.xml to use this class as the main class:

````xml path=TrialFX/TrialLayout/JFXLayout/pom.xml mode=EDIT
<plugin>
 <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
 <artifactId>javafx-maven-plugin</artifactId>
 <version>0.0.8</version>
 <executions>
 <execution>
 <!-- Default configuration for running with: mvn clean javafx:run -->
 <id>default-cli</id>
 <configuration>
 <mainClass>com.tama.layoutjfx.VBoxApp</mainClass>
 <launcher>app</launcher>
 <jlinkZipName>app</jlinkZipName>
 <jlinkImageName>app</jlinkImageName>
 <noManPages>true</noManPages>
 <stripDebug>true</stripDebug>
 <noHeaderFiles>true</noHeaderFiles>
 </configuration>
 </execution>
 </executions>
</plugin>
````

Key changes:
1. Changed VBox maxHeight/maxWidth to "Infinity" to allow unlimited growth
2. Set VBox.vgrow="NEVER" for the GridPane to keep it at its preferred size
3. Set VBox.vgrow="ALWAYS" for the TableView to make it expand to fill available space
4. Created a VBoxApp class that loads the FXML and sets stage.setMaximized(true)
5. Updated the pom.xml to use VBoxApp as the main class
